results.title: The Girls and daddy
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Melodrama by D.W. Griffith about two young ladies and a burglar. The film is presented in two parts: first, the scenes in the order in which they were photographed, and then as edited. The first part is silent, and the second has a musical accompaniment. Cast includes David Miles, Florence Lawrence, Dorothy West, Mack Sennett.

results.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
results.creator_credit: Det Danske Filminstitut, Nordisk Film, ZDF, Yellow Bird, Film Capital Stockholm, Spiltan Underhållning, Nordisk Film & TV Fond, Svenska Filminstitutet, SVT, Film i Väst, Niels Sejer, Søren Stærmose, Niels Arden Oplev, Cilla Rörby, Nikolaj Arcel and Rasmus Heisterberg
results.brief_description: Swedish thriller based on Stieg Larsson’s novel about a male journalist and a young female hacker. In the opening of the movie, Mikael Blomkvist, a middle-aged publisher for the magazine Millennium, loses a libel case brought by corrupt Swedish industrialist Hans-Erik Wennerström. Nevertheless, he is hired by Henrik Vanger in order to solve a cold case, the disappearance of Vanger’s niece

constellations_other.name: Collective: investigative journalism on screen
constellations_other.description: In Collective, documentarian Alexander Nanau follows a team of journalists who uncover a far-reaching government conspiracy following a deadly nightclub fire in Romania that kills dozens.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Det Danske Filminstitut, Nordisk Film, ZDF, Yellow Bird, Film Capital Stockholm, Spiltan Underhållning, Nordisk Film & TV Fond, Svenska Filminstitutet, SVT, Film i Väst, Niels Sejer, Søren Stærmose, Niels Arden Oplev, Cilla Rörby, Nikolaj Arcel and Rasmus Heisterberg

results.title: The Girl who wanted to dance = Bu Dang yan yuan de gu niang
results.creator_credit: Guang Chunlan and Tianshan Film Studio
results.brief_description:
The film tells the story about a Uyghur dancer and her estranged daughter. Amina and Nur went to Tianshan district, Xinjiang to recruit new students on behalf of the Provincial Song and Dance Ensemble. A girl with a beautiful singing voice called, Mayila caught Amina’s attention. It happened that Amina’s estranged daughter during the Cultural Revolution many years ago was also called Mayila. Amina and Nur’s recruitment work went well but Mayila’s foster father would not allow her to take the test as he hated to let her go. Amina sent Nur to talk to Mayila’s father, and the latter realized that Mayila was Amina’s daughter. He decided to allow Mayila to go and gave her a pair of beautiful dancing shoes, telling her that she should only wear them for the National Day Celebration Performance. Amina saw the shoes one night in Mayila’s dorm and knew Mayila was her daughter, because the shoes were left for Mayila by her years ago. She didn’t tell Mayila the truth so that she could concentrate on training. In the meantime, Mayila learned from her father’s letter that Amina was her biological mother. On the National Day Celebration Performance, Amina and Mayila played mother and daughter characters. Their performance was wonderful and Mayila called Amina mum on the stage.

The film was awarded Best Film by the Ministry of Culture in 1984, and won a major prize at a Turkish Film Festival in 1985. The film presents a few scenes of Uyghur dancing. Established in 1958, the film studio was originally called Xinjiang Film Studio. In 1979, the film studio changed its name to Tianshan Film Studio and has produced more than one hundred films, mostly about Chinese ethnic groups, since then. Director Guang Chunlan also made Death of a Beauty and The Mysterious Caravan. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The Girl who spelled freedom
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, R.W. Goodwin and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Based on newspaper articles and personal interviews with Linn Yann, this moving film tells of one young Cambodian girl refugees experiences in America and her fight to be accepted. With the support of her caring American sponsors (played by Mary Kay Place and Wayne Rogers), Linn Yann (Jade Chinn) overcomes the strangeness of her new country and makes a name for herself by winning the regional spelling competition, thus bringing attention to the plight of other refugees like her.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simon Wincer, R.W. Goodwin and Walt Disney Animation Studios

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris
results.creator_credit: Richard Brennan, Richard Wherrett and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Regarded as one of Australia’s acclaimed theatre and artistic directors, Richard Wherrett has transformed his directing skills into film with this adaptation of “The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir in Paris. Cast includes Tony Llewellyn-Jones, Judy Morris, Anna Volska and John Clayton. Director of Photography, Geoff Burton.

results.title: The Girl who met Simone de Beauvoir
results.creator_credit: Richard Wherrett, Television and Radio School, AFTRS and Richard Brennan
results.brief_description: Adapted from a short story by Frank Moorhouse, this is a lighthearted presentation of a man’s difficulty in coping with women’s liberation and the new position of some women in society.

results.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
results.creator_credit: Kadokawa Haruki Corporation and Haruki Kadokawa
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
results.creator_credit: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera
results.brief_description: When 17-year-old Makoto Konno gains the ability to, quite literally, “leap” backwards through time, she immediately sets about improving her grades and preventing personal mishaps. However, she soon realises that changing the past isn’t as simple as it seems, and eventually, will have to rely on her new powers to shape the future of herself and her friends.

constellations_other.name: Obviously the time continuum has been disrupted...again and again and again!
constellations_other.description: Eadweard Muybridge was able to capture time and play it back again creating endless time paradoxes where subjects are destined to repeat their previous actions. Filmmakers have since explored such notions via time travel narratives questioning destiny, fate and choice.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Happinet Pictures, Kadokawa Pictures, Memory Tech, Q-Tec, Toki wo Kakeru Shôjo Seisaku Iinkai 2006, Madhouse, Sound Box, Kadokawa Shoten Publishing, Takafumi Watanabe, Jungo Maruta, Mamoru Hosoda, Yuichiro Saito and Satoko Okudera

results.title: The Girl on the Train
results.creator_credit: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor
results.brief_description: Rachel Watson, devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day, until one morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Reliance Entertainment, DreamWorks Pictures, Marc Platt Productions, Amblin Partners, Erin Cressida Wilson, Ann Roth, Michelle Matland, Jared LeBoff, Marc Platt, Kevin Thompson and Tate Taylor

results.title: The Girl on the bridge = La Fille sur le port [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Patrice Leconte, Christian Fechner, UGCF, Canal+, Fechner Productions and UGC Images
results.brief_description: Patrice Leconte (Monsieur Hire, Ridicule, The Hairdresser’s husband) directed this romantic fantasy about an aging knife thrower and a beautiful young wayward woman that he meets one night contemplating suicide on a bridge. Gabor (Daniel Auteuil) is a talented performer whose cool demeanour mirrors an emotional wasteland; Adele (Vanessa Paradis) has a history of bad luck, in particular regarding sexual experiences, which tend to leave her destitute and lonely. As Gabor and Adele join forces, they create a daring and erotic stage act and their luck turns to gold. The two share a telepathic bond that enables them to converse from separate locales and intensifies their mutual attraction, tested by Adele’s whimsical attractions to a myriad of suitors. Set in France and Monaco and shot in black and white the film is aesthetically pleasing with a charming soundtrack but at times seems to have the appearance (and depth) of a television commercial. “The Girl on the bridge” has a comical tone and its beguiling leads and exotic settings buoy the film making it a mostly enjoyable cinematic experience.
